summary: This is a Law360 Public Policy newsletter from April 15, 2020. It contains a summary of an Eleventh Circuit court ruling that denied a petition from a victim of Jeffrey Epstein, stating her rights were not violated by the non-prosecution agreement because federal prosecutors never formally charged Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as a billionaire sex offender with whom a non-prosecution deal was reached.

events.title: 11th Circuit Denies Victim's Petition
events.description: A divided Eleventh Circuit panel denied a petition from a victim of Jeffrey Epstein challenging the non-prosecution deal reached with him, ruling her rights as a victim were not violated because federal prosecutors never formally brought charges against Epstein.

keyFacts: The Eleventh Circuit Court of Appeals denied a petition from a victim of Jeffrey Epstein challenging the non-prosecution agreement.
The court ruled the victim's rights were not violated because federal prosecutors never formally brought criminal charges against Epstein.
The document is a Law360 newsletter summarizing this legal development dated April 15, 2020.
